html:
5.14.24  8:35 pm   How long have you been learning Dutch?

      i've been listening to it intensely on and off for 1 year now

5.14.24  8:10 pm   bill do you like geometry?

      yes

5.14.24  7:32 pm   When will we ever run out of things.

      that seems impossible because everything is a thing

5.14.24  7:05 pm   which came first, the chicken or the chicken?

      i have no idea

5.14.24  7:03 pm   i dont have a question

      ok, in that case i will go to lunch

5.14.24  5:46 pm   i want to learn all the languages what do I do 

      learn some of the most major ones, and that will make it easier to learn some of the others

5.14.24  5:42 pm   Have you ever thought about compiling these questions into a book that you could publish? Maybe do a little curation and organize by category, could be a hit!

      the problem with compilation books for ongoing content streams is that the book always seems to truncate before the end of the content stream. i have a book of hit songs and info about them, and the book randomly ends after 'in the club' by 50 cent

5.14.24  5:21 pm   do you have what it takes

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

5.14.24  4:52 pm   Who are your favorite musicians?

      that would be unfair to favor musicians. so many of them are trying their best, already worrying enough about who's favorite they are

5.14.24  4:08 pm   whats the most recent thing

      what do you want it to be

5.14.24  2:29 pm   1. how much time do you devote to reading/answering emails nowadays? I know you're already slammed with making the new vids, seems like a lesser priority but idk!!

2. Do you still accept emails like fanmail, lengthier questions, etc? Do you have a filter for anything? is it just for business now? I feel the urge to email you but I don't wanna be clogging up the inbox

      i would love to hear from you

5.14.24  2:26 pm   How do you feel about using other-sensory words like "warm" "shimmering" or "pungent" to describe auditory experiences 

      fine, except i wouldn't say 'pungent'. i'd be more likely to say 'poignant'

5.14.24  2:21 pm   i have so many partially overlapping todo lists that i need a list to keep track of them all. how am i doing?

      pretty good. you can look forward to that epiphany when you put it all into a master list that makes all the sense you ever dreamed of

5.14.24  2:09 pm   are there any other programming projects you'd like to complete?

      it would be cool to calculate exactly everything that's ever happened in the past, based on exactly how everything is at present

5.14.24  2:01 pm   sometimes i get a little hungry

      who do you think you are

5.14.24  1:47 pm   so in my mother tongue, we have a specific word for the pants you wear at home. like the ones that are comfy and you wear it all the time (so not pajamas cause you usually wear them to sleep if I'm correct). What do people call them in English?

      the american english word for this is often 'sweatpants'. something thinner than sweatpants is often called, and you're not gonna like this, 'pajama pants'. although i'm disappointed that you didn't say which language you're talking about

5.14.24  1:47 pm   what percentage of the objects in your mind are exportable?

      i'm not sure

5.14.24  12:42 pm   what makes a taste an acquired taste

      when people say "acquired taste" they usually mean it's really bad, but maybe you can get used to it

5.14.24  12:17 pm   What was the inspiration for "At the corner store"?

      the melody (for the title section) came first. it had a dummy lyric, something like "at the corner store, getting what you need for the brand new world" or something very similar to what you've heard on the final. i was very insistent that this should not be the actual line, this should not be the title, this song shall not be about the corner store. i had the impression that i had already made too many references to 'stores' before. but after trying my hardest i couldn't come up with any other lyrical home for that melody figure. so corner store it was

5.14.24  11:27 am   What is the powerhouse of the cell

      constantinople

5.14.24  11:16 am   For the first time ever I wrote through an entire fucking notebook and it feels GOOD!!! You know what I mean?

      no, i don't have the goal of filling notebooks. the finite size of a notebook does not affect my note writing. my note writing style is more catered to the infinite sized notebook, at least in spirit

5.14.24  10:45 am   What is a four letter word
True or False

      'true', by multiple interpretations

5.14.24  10:00 am   Can piano keys unlock doors?

      yes

5.14.24  9:50 am   how do u suppose i detatch myself from the materialistic world of desire and constant dependence on external factors for approval and happiness 

      make a video called "i detatched myself from the materialistic world of desire and constant dependence on external factors for approval and happiness, for a whole week, and this happened (in 2024)" with a red arrow in the thumbnail

5.14.24  8:03 am   what do you want for yourself 

      i want to fully accept some of the opportunities that i have

5.14.24  7:56 am   what is the color of your favorite guitar

      surprise me

5.14.24  6:50 am   hey bill i really like ur songs and since its been awhile since ive been here in general i just wanted to ask you how ur doing

      pretty good

5.14.24  6:22 am   can you explain implied chords to me

      sure, although i'm afraid it won't be much more than just defining the word 'imply'. let's say you hear a melody but not the chords. but it just sounds super obvious that the chords should be a certain way. like if you draw a person wearing shoes, it is implied that the person has feet inside the shoes

5.14.24  1:16 am   how did you learn how to notate music? i was checking out some of your older songs and have a lot of respect for how you wrote things down bc when i try to remember how to play something i wrote, i always have to listen to the voice memo i inevitably record

      it's not hard to learn how to do it, and then you get good at it if you just do it a lot, but nowadays it's not necessarily any better than using audio. most people use audio. i use audio

5.14.24  1:09 am   what is the coolest thing ever?

      it's a tie between making patterns and breaking them

5.14.24  12:48 am   I went outside for the first time. Is this a problem?

      if recently, then there are problematic implications, based on your fluent english writing, from which we can infer at least a certain number of years of your life that you'd had never been outside before

5.13.24  11:55 pm   If the meanings of words in a language change one by one, when all the meanings change, is it still the same language?

      that reminds me of the time i replaced my entire boat, one piece at a time

5.13.24  11:13 pm   can't cheesiness be a good quality?

      yes. especially in the context of cheese

5.13.24  10:15 pm   does the sun have to be so bright?

      yes

5.13.24  8:58 pm   how do you feel about frozen pizza that was previously cooked but before that it was previously frozen

      it's now ready to cook

5.13.24  8:53 pm   the voices in my head are being mean, can you give an epic comeback

      how about a voice

5.13.24  8:33 pm   You know how in english (or at least american english, maybe there's different ones in other english speaking countries) there's those filler words like "uh" or "um" or "so" or "like", etc. What are some of the filler words you'd hear in dutch? 

      you have uh/um. (those are pretty universal). you have "nou,", which is sometimes like the english "now," (when it doesn't mean "time"). sometimes "nou" is slightly more contradictory, like "well," in english. you have "dus" which is sort of like "so" but also like "thus" (which english doesn't use anymore). you have "soort van" which is literally "sort of", ... you have "eigenlijk" which is usually similar to "actually", you have "gewoon" which often is similar to "just", although it often appears in a different word order. you also have "even" (sounds like "effe"), which is a lot like "just" when it means "real quick". you have "zeg maar" (literally "say but") which means "so to speak", but maybe better aligns with english "i guess" added after something, for approximation. you have "een beetje" which is literallly "a bit", similar to british usage. you have "ik bedoel", literally "i mean", identical to english usage, and you have "denk ik" which means "i think" when added to the end of a phrase. you have "weet je?" literally "y'know". you have "natuurlijk" which is used like english "of course". and most of all you have "nou ja" or "naja", which often means something like "i mean yeah", or "well yeah,". And then, you have "lekker" which means tasty (or "tastily"), but it's somehow a filler word for almost all situations, whether it's something you enjoy actually or sarcastically

5.13.24  8:26 pm   thoughts on spaghetti

      don't think on spaghetti, think WITH spaghetti

5.13.24  8:26 pm   how is your life

      let's just say it's average

5.13.24  7:48 pm   do you ever listen to something once and think 'eh that sounds so-so' but then you listen to it again a few months or years later and you realize 'holy shit this is really good'?

      sure

5.13.24  5:33 pm   How many aliens did you see in the last 27 years?

      i have no idea what an alien looks like, if anything

5.13.24  4:54 pm   do you play keytar?

      no

5.13.24  4:12 pm   how to improve at something you like doing?

      well there's no way to avoid that

5.13.24  3:56 pm   Are you the main character? 

      sure but is this the main story

5.13.24  2:45 pm   i need to name my cat

      the most important thing when naming a cat is to know the cat. the biggest mistake in naming a cat is to name the cat before knowing the cat. do you understand (y/n)

5.13.24  1:20 pm   Have you begun lifting weights?

      yes

5.13.24  12:54 pm   Do you ever listen to music while working on something that doesn't require playing with audio?

      i'm more likely to listen to speaking

5.13.24  12:04 pm   is there any way to know if something is too difficult for you to do, Before spending months on it and failing miserably?

      yes, you could try a somewhat less amount of time, thereby limiting your failure to a smaller amount

5.13.24  12:03 pm   have you ever thought about what you think the real truth might be?

      a bit

5.13.24  9:30 am   How do you find the discipline to learn a topic so thoroughly so as to make it into art?

      if you want to do it, then there's no need to search for discipline. and if you don't want to do it then of course there's no need to do it
